tweets.html:
*sobs* RT @ENLISTEDonFOX: What was your favorite moment from last night's #enlisted? http://t.co/BJqedQysJR

— Holly Jolly Christmas (@hollye83) June 23, 2014

The use of “too” is my favorite sequel-title conceit because it’s so honest. “Did you like THINK LIKE A MAN? This is also THINK LIKE A MAN.”

— Noel Murray (@NoelMu) June 23, 2014

Christina Hendrix is speaking at the White House Working Families Summit about challenges working women faced in "Mad Men era."

— Catherine Rampell (@crampell) June 23, 2014

I love Christina Hendricks, but is the White House going to have Kiefer Sutherland speak at a summit on terrorism? https://t.co/Z40ijTvULS

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) June 23, 2014

@crampell @washingtonpost Does this mean Bryan Cranston will be speaking at next drug policy confab?

— Kristen Muller (@KrisMul) June 23, 2014

So is 'Rising Star' that next big thing? The short answer is no. The long answer? Nooooooo: http://t.co/zFkGaAGmvV

— Entertainment Weekly (@EW) June 23, 2014

Have to 'break ground' when burying yourself. "@RisingStarABC: Watch last night’s groundbreaking series premiere of #RisingStar."

— The TV Answer Man (@SwanniOnTV) June 23, 2014

ABC boasts there were 129K tweets about “Rising Star” last night. Only 1K of them were me mocking the marginalizing of West Coast viewers!

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) June 23, 2014

To improve our chances of getting on tv, we all need to lose 15 pounds or gain 400 pounds

— Dan Hopper (@DanHopp) June 23, 2014

Gurl, you must be a main character on "True Blood," because when you're gone, no one will care.

— Ben Siemon (@BenjaminJS) June 23, 2014

Does NYC provide some service where I can rent a child to go see How to Train Your Dragon 2 with me so I'm not creepy? Or is that creepy?

— Emalee Burditt (@emaleeburditt) June 23, 2014

I'd love to see a cooking show where the chef just gives up, orders a pizza and tells stories about doing coke with now famous chefs.

— Jen Kirwin (@JennKirwin) June 23, 2014

[Cannon] BOOM: AMC has ordered a second season of TURN.

So, *two* every season, Turn, Turn, Turn? [sorry]

— TV MoJoe (@TVMoJoe) June 23, 2014

$5 to anyone who has actually watched all of "Turn"

— Margaret Lyons (@margeincharge) June 23, 2014

Argh! I just got it! Revolution. "Turn." (Not sure what I thought before. Maybe "Turn channels. "Mad Men" isn't on yet.")

— Phil Rosenthal (@phil_rosenthal) June 23, 2014

America's shitty healthcare system gave us Scrubs, Breaking Bad, and The Simpsons episode "Homer's Triple Bypass". So it's not all bad.

— Ben Paddon 🎄 (@BenPaddon) June 23, 2014

I didn't need Buzzfeed to tell me that I am a Liz Lemon, but they did, and they're right.

— itsonlyzach (@itsonlyzach) June 23, 2014

Penalty. Ref pulls his yellow card... but it's red? Looks closer. Blood. He turns. Hot breath. Fangs dripping. Wendigo didn't like the call.

— Sean Thomason (@TheThomason) June 23, 2014

If you don't have Univision on right now, you're not doing it right

— Ishaan Tharoor (@ishaantharoor) June 23, 2014

God I hope someone is working on an oral history of "It's Pat" for its 20th anniversary in August.

— Margaret Lyons (@margeincharge) June 23, 2014

one day the soulja boy is going to be considered an 'old school dance'

— Brokey the Christmas Heaux (@brokeymcpoverty) June 23, 2014

Who is the person that can go to a live Jeopardy taping and not shout out the answers? Surely, they are more civilized than me.

— Nick Campbell (@sononick) June 24, 2014

Overflowing with gratitude at the chance to hear Robin Thicke's side of the story.

— billy eichner (@billyeichner) June 24, 2014

Trying to convince Robin Thicke that a forgiving Paula Patton is hiding behind a bunch of boxes in my basement that need to be cleaned out.

— itsonlyzach (@itsonlyzach) June 23, 2014

Thicky Trick > Robin Thicke #TheGoodWife

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 24, 2014

Writing New Girl Season 4... Turns out I'm much more comfortable writing about single people. It'd be nice if that changed at some point.

— Liz Meriwether (@lizmeriwether) June 24, 2014

I’m just sayin’ that if you *have* to commit murder, you could do worse than committing murder for Tyra Collette.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) June 24, 2014

i was like "maybe i should stop watching tv for a little while" but then i was like "ugh no i don't wanna read a dumb book."

— Sophie 🌹 (@insopherable) June 24, 2014

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
soon newspapers will be "that weird thing from the last season of #TheWire"

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) June 24, 2014

#PennyDreadful is what #AHS should be. It's American Horror Story with an actual cohesive narrative, good writing and it's, you know, SCARY.

— Michael Meyer 🏳️‍🌈 (@HoganBCMJ) June 24, 2014

Piper is probably the only character on #OITNB who would actually sit through the theme song for each episode.

— Harry Shuldman (@HarryShuldman) June 24, 2014

Seeing UNDER THE DOME condensed to an hour summary makes for great comedy.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) June 24, 2014

I feel like all the "Shows You Can't Miss This Summer" lists are really just "Shows on TV This Summer" lists.

— Danielle Nussbaum (@daniellenuss) June 24, 2014

SUMMER TV, BABY. pic.twitter.com/7rJhHohFpv

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 24, 2014

She has a secret admirer? I bet it's one of the guys on the show. #TheBachelorette

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) June 24, 2014

And with the entrance of the lie detector test, #thebachelorette is officially one step closer to being Flavor of Love.

— Emily L. Foley (@EmilyLFoley) June 24, 2014

I think "Boy, The Bachelorette has gotten a lot stupider" is the thing you think right before you exchange your eyeballs for magic beans.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) June 24, 2014

Andi is feeling a "huge cloud of doubt," which I suspect is precipitated by Josh's odd winter scarf/Underarmor combo. #Bachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) June 24, 2014

Someday on one of these freaking things, the Bachelorette will eat the rose, and I will know the struggle is over. #TheBachelorette

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) June 24, 2014

All of ABC Family's sitcom promos make me want to hole up in a bunker and never come out.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) June 24, 2014

thankfully my wife calls before she comes home so i can switch from watching teen wolf to watching pro wrestling

— I Hate Celery (@Slennon_) June 24, 2014

They put Derek in Guy Fieri's restaurant. The best hiding place of them all. #TeenWolf

— pj evans (@pjayevans) June 24, 2014

"All we want is Derek." Scott speaks for the audience. #TeenWolf

— Melissa Mann (@PhantomRat) June 24, 2014

What WOULDN'T they want with Derek. #TeenWolf

— melissa miller (@Serrae) June 24, 2014

What WOULDN'T they want with Lydia? #TeenWolf #HairTips

— melissa miller (@Serrae) June 24, 2014

"We'll think of something. We always do. It's like this shit is scripted." #TeenWolf

— melissa miller (@Serrae) June 24, 2014

Kira and her samurai sword are the best couple on #TeenWolf.

— Melissa Mann (@PhantomRat) June 24, 2014

Kate hid Derek behind the carving of a pig-faced jaguar god. Like that isn't the first place we'd all look. #TeenWolf

— Melissa Mann (@PhantomRat) June 24, 2014

I have chest hair questions. #TeenWolf

— melissa miller (@Serrae) June 24, 2014

I understood exactly none of what happened. #TeenWolf

— Melissa Mann (@PhantomRat) June 24, 2014

KISSING CURES A LOT OF MENTAL ISSUES IN THE TEEN WOLF UNIVERSE.

— Sophie 🌹 (@insopherable) June 24, 2014

Jack Bauer's got the kind of international swag that terrorist leaders can just take one look at his face and name him. #24LAD

— Dexter Goad (@ShadowDogProd) June 24, 2014

We all know if Jack Bauer didn't have a gun but borrowed a slingshot from Dennis The Menace, he'd STILL rack up a high body count. #24LAD

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) June 24, 2014

I'm digging "Jack Bauer: Nonchalant Mid-Terrorist Attack Helicopter Pilot."

— Matt Mitovich (@MattMitovich) June 24, 2014

So Jack Bauer has turned into John McClane if John McClane were bitten by a radioactive spider? I'm here for it. #24LAD

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) June 24, 2014

Jack Bauer: now, always, and forever the greatest Impossible White Man in all of existence. #24LAD

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) June 24, 2014

Note to self: never walk near an open window with Jack Bauer

— NDPoot (@PootND) June 24, 2014

Jack will not leave London until he has thrown every single citizen from a 5th floor window. That is the remaining 30 mins of this episode.

— BUM CHILLUPS (@edsbs) June 24, 2014

HOLY SHIT! Jack Bauer checked all his pockets, found no fucks, realized he had none to give, and defenestrated her! Ah ha ha! #24LAD

— Dexter Goad (@ShadowDogProd) June 24, 2014

.@ReelTalker You just know if Jack Bauer went after Joe Carroll instead of Ryan Hardy, THE FOLLOWING would've ended by Episode 2.

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) June 24, 2014

#RedWeddingSeason2 #24LAD

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 24, 2014

Starting to think I should be watching #24LAD entirely via Twitter. pic.twitter.com/yNbL8KUbGU

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) June 24, 2014

My favorite thing in #24LAD is watching Stephen Frye count his paycheck in his head mid-scene.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 24, 2014

Jack Bauer: not having a single fuck in his possession to give since 2001. #24LAD

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) June 24, 2014

I've really liked #24LAD, both despite and because of the laughing fit it just gave me. #NeverChange

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) June 24, 2014
